title: Ticket #4329: Recognize loopback interface as a way to send data to ourself
description:
Several places in HTCondor use utililty method Sinful::addressPointsToMe() to determine if a daemon is about to send a message to itself. Unfortunately, this method does not understand that use of the loopback interface (eg 127.0.0.1) could result in a daemon sending a message to itself. This ticket will address this shortcoming.

Why do we care? Well, US CMS would like to have 

    CONDOR_VIEW_HOST = 127.0.0.1:9618

in their multi-tier collector setup so that the child collectors send large datagrams to the parent collector (see #4321), but still want the parent collector to understand the semantics of loopback to avoid sending updates back to itself.
remarks:
2014-Apr-23 14:05:13 by tannenba:
TESTING

Config with the following in condor_config.local: 

CONDOR_HOST = $(IP_ADDRESS):9618
CONDOR_VIEW_HOST = 127.0.0.1:9618
COLLECTOR_DEBUG = D_FULLDEBUG

Before the patch, when starting up the collector we see the following in the collector log: 

   ...
   04/23/14 11:53:08 DaemonCore: command socket at <128.115.25.57:9618>
   ...
   04/23/14 11:53:08 Will use UDP to update collector <127.0.0.1:9618>
   04/23/14 11:53:08 Will forward ads on to View Server 127.0.0.1:9618
   04/23/14 11:53:08 enable: Creating stats hash table
   ...

After the patch, when starting up the collector we see the following in the collector log: 

   ...
   04/23/14 11:53:48 DaemonCore: command socket at <128.115.25.57:9618>
   ...
   04/23/14 11:53:48 Will use UDP to update collector <127.0.0.1:9618>
   04/23/14 11:53:48 Not forwarding to View Server 127.0.0.1:9618 - self referential
   04/23/14 11:53:48 enable: Creating stats hash table
   ...

2014-Apr-23 14:31:32 by tannenba:
Both myself and wrangler agree this patch does not warrant a version history entry. Assign to Zach for code review, since he is familiar with this issue. I feel good about the patch, but it is pretty low level (used by view collector, ccb, security layers), thus code review to be sure.

2017-Jun-26 13:16:57 by zmiller:
CODE REVIEW: Not only does the code look good, it has been in the codebase since 8.2.0. Resolving.
